After configuring the library\'s main folder, the application will analyze the files in the informed folder, identifying the mangas/comics that have the extension such as cbr/rar, cbz/zip and tar.
These files will then be displayed in list format and can be deleted or added to favorites.

For better performance, a copy of the first page will be kept, which will be displayed as the cover, it will be necessary due to the limitation of rar/cbr files in using much of the computational resource available only for the display of a single page.
The reader has the ability to scroll between pages and move to a specific page. A bookmark of the page opened in the last reading will be stored in memory, which in turn will be loaded on opening.
It also has resources to read json files embedded in the file or external, which contain texts extracted from the pages.

For ease of use it will be displayed below the filename it will be the name of the page that is currently displayed, it will be very useful to identify which caption to select when the automatic selection does not work.

The app is able to load properly formatted json files with texts that were previously extracted from the pages, along with the texts the file can also contain a list of vocabularies in which it can be recognized and located in the display.
The main screen of subtitles will be the import, where it will show the chapters that contain the file and a json file with the subtitles can also be imported.
The first field will be used to load an external subtitle file, which will overwrite the subtitle that was embedded in the file.

The second field will contain a listing of the chapters found both in the file and in the external json that was chosen, when selecting a certain chapter the application will fill in the data in the caption tab.

The third field will be responsible for the language that will be switched, it will overwrite the language defined in the settings screen, it will be used so that it can be easily switched between another language that may be listed.
After selecting the caption, you will be automatically directed to the caption tab, this tab will manage the content of the selected caption and will display the text.

The first field on the tab will contain the selected page within the caption and can be changed at any time. For ease of use, the field contains, in addition to the sequential number of pages in the chapter, the name of the original page from which the caption was processed.
Each button on this screen will perform the same function as the popup menu, when held down for a while the button will present a brief description of what it does.

It performs the exchange between subtitles of different languages in which they were informed in the configuration screen. In an example you can switch between Japanese and English subtitles with just one click and the application will automatically find the corresponding chapter and page in the target language.

It draws the coordinates from which the texts that are in the subtitle file were extracted, it will also add the sequential number of the text to better identify which order it is. More information in the section below about the floating popup.

Search the selected page within the subtitle file, each subtitle file will contain the name and a hash of the page which will be used in the search to find the selected page. The search will find both the chapter and the corresponding page.
Forwards or backwards the selected text.
The subtitle file can contain a list of vocabularies and will be displayed in this tab, the list corresponds to each page processed, where it will always be updated when changing the page.
The application uses the powerful feature provided by sudachi for word recognition within text. This makes it possible to locate the meaning of each word within a vocabulary list.
The application has kanji recognition in which it queries an internal database that contains 3000 kanji with their main readings and meaning.
To use it, in the legend tab, just click on the kanji and a popup with information will be displayed.

The floating popup is a resource for better visualization of the obtained texts, it will create a screen directly in the operating system which can facilitate its visualization even in split screen, as it can be anywhere on the screen.

It will have all the main features that the subtitle setup menu, page information, control buttons and vocabulary directly into its content. With a simple click on a word in the text, the application will search the vocabulary for the word and show it to the user.
In addition to the control buttons this screen will also have a button to minimize the size of the popup, close it and move the entire scroll to the top.

With a touch on the right or upper corner it is possible to move the popup, it also accepts gestures, where inside the screen content dragging to the left will go to the next text and dragging to the right will return, a long click on the text will do copy it and double click it will go to the next one.
The application supports json files of english, portuguese and japanese languages.
